solution_line_template: The second drink was {second_drink_ounces}/{first_drink_ounces}=1/6 the size of the first drink
That means it had {caffeine_ratio}*{first_drink_caffeine}=<<{first_drink_caffeine}/2={second_drink_caffeine}>>{second_drink_caffeine} grams of caffeine
So the total amount of caffeine he drank was {second_drink_caffeine}+{first_drink_caffeine}=<<{second_drink_caffeine}+{first_drink_caffeine}={total_drink_caffeine}>>{total_drink_caffeine} grams
So he consumed {total_drink_caffeine}*{caffeine_pill_multiplier}=<<{total_drink_caffeine}*{caffeine_pill_multiplier}={total_caffeine}>>{total_caffeine} grams of caffeine for the day
